-- Hoogle documentation, generated by Haddock
-- See Hoogle, http://www.haskell.org/hoogle/


-- | Finding palindromes in strings
--   
--   palindromes is an executable and a library which takes a file name,
--   and returns information about palindromes in the file.
@package palindromes
@version 0.4

module Data.Algorithms.Palindromes.PalindromesUtils
data Flag
Help :: Flag
Plain :: Flag
Text :: Flag
Word :: Flag
DNA :: Flag
Extend :: Int -> Flag
Linear :: Flag
Quadratic :: Flag
Longest :: Flag
LengthLongest :: Flag
Maximal :: Flag
LengthMaximal :: Flag
Gap :: Int -> Flag
NrOfErrors :: Int -> Flag
LengthAtLeast :: Int -> Flag
LengthAtMost :: Int -> Flag
LengthExact :: Int -> Flag
LengthBetween :: Int -> Int -> Flag
StandardInput :: Flag
negateDNA :: Char -> Char
showPalindromeDNA :: ByteString -> (Int, Int) -> String
(=:=) :: Word8 -> Word8 -> Bool
showPalindrome :: ByteString -> (Int, Int) -> String
showTextPalindrome :: ByteString -> Array Int Int -> (Int, Int) -> String
myIsLetterC :: Char -> Bool
myIsLetterW :: Word8 -> Bool
myToLower :: Word8 -> Word8
surroundedByPunctuation :: Int -> Int -> ByteString -> Bool
appendseq :: ([a], Seq a) -> [a]
listArrayl0 :: [a] -> Array Int a

module Data.Algorithms.Palindromes.Palindromes

-- | palindrome captures all possible variants of finding palindromes.
palindrome :: Maybe Flag -> Maybe Flag -> Maybe Flag -> Maybe Flag -> Maybe Flag -> Maybe Flag -> ByteString -> String

-- | palindromesAroundCentres is the central function of the module. It
--   returns the list of lenghths of the longest palindrome around each
--   position in a string.
palindromesAroundCentres :: Maybe Flag -> Maybe Flag -> Maybe Flag -> Maybe Flag -> ByteString -> ByteString -> Array Int Int -> [Int]
dnaLengthGappedApproximatePalindromeAround :: Maybe Flag -> Maybe Flag -> Int -> ByteString -> String
